remarks: The currying of an operation given in maps-to notation, splitting the operation (function of two arguments) into a function of the first argument, producing a function over the second argument.  (Contributed by AV, 27-Oct-2019.)
statement:
mpt2curryd.f $e |- F = ( x e. X , y e. Y |-> C ) $.
mpt2curryd.c $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. X A. y e. Y C e. V ) $.
mpt2curryd.n $e |- ( ph -> Y =/= (/) ) $.
mpt2curryd $p |- ( ph -> curry F = ( x e. X |-> ( y e. Y |-> C ) ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d V x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
$d Y x y $.
$d ph x y $.
$d ph x y $.
